note_text: DATE OF PROCEDURE: 12/16/2025   CC Referred Physician: Self, Referred No address on file   INDICATION FOR OPERATION: Elen Rogers is a 65 year old-year-old female who presents with Malignant Pleural Effusion. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Chest Ultrasound and Chest tube placement were discussed with the patient in detail. Patient indicated a wish to proceed with procedure and informed consent was signed.   CONSENT : Obtained before the procedure. Its indications and potential complications and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate. The patient or surrogate read and signed the provided consent form / provided consent over the phone. The consent was witnessed by an assisting medical professional.   PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Pleural Effusion (Malignant) POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same as preoperative diagnosis - see above.   PROCEDURE:  76604 Ultrasound, chest (includes mediastinum), real time with image documentation 32557 Insert catheter pleura with imaging (chest tube)   76604 was performed on the right side   ATTENDING:  John Smith, MD   ASSISTANT:   Mary Clark  MD   Support Staff: RN: Bedside RN   MONITORING : Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.   PROCEDURE IN DETAIL: All procedure related images were saved and archived in Media folder on Onedrive behind UCSD firewall, relevant images are also uploaded to PACS system or in the media section of the patient's chart.   PATIENT POSITION: ‌ Supine  X ‌ Sitting   ‌ Lateral Decubitus: ‌ Right ‌ Left   CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS:  X ‌ Image saved and up loaded to epic media tab Hemithorax:   X ‌ Right ‌ Left   Pleural Effusion: Volume:       ‌ None  ‌ Minimal  ‌ Small ‌ X Moderate ‌ Large Echogenicity:   ‌X Anechoic  ‌ Hypoechoic  ‌ Isoechoic ‌ Hyperechoic Loculations:  ‌ X None  ‌Thin  ‌ Thick Diaphragmatic Motion: ‌ X Normal  ‌ Diminished;  ‌ Absent  Lung: Lung sliding before procedure:   X ‌ Present ‌ Absent Lung sliding post procedure:   X ‌ Present ‌ Absent Lung consolidation/atelectasis: ‌ Present  X ‌ Absent Pleura:  ‌ Normal  ‌ Thick ‌ X Nodular   Insertion site prepped and draped in sterile fashion.   ANESTHESIA:  Lidocaine 1%: 5__ ml     Other: ______ Entry Site: X ‌ Right 8__ Intercostal Space   ‌ Left ___ Intercostal Space ‌ Mid-clavicular   ‌ Mid-axillary  X ‌ Mid-scapular  ‌ Other:   Size:  ‌ 6Fr  ‌ 8Fr  X ‌ 12FR  ‌ 14Fr  ‌ 16Fr  ‌ 18Fr  ‌ 24Fr   ‌ 32 Fr  ‌ Other: Sutured: ‌X  Yes ‌ No   PROCEDURE FINDINGS: A  pigtail catheter was inserted using the Seldinger technique. Entry into the pleural space was confirmed with the easy removal of minimal serous appearing pleural fluid. A guidewire was inserted using the introducer needle pointed in the apical posterior direction. The introducer needle was then removed. A dilator was then inserted over the wire with a twisting motion in order to form a tract for catheter insertion. The dilator was removed and the pigtail catheter (with trochar) was advanced over the guidewire. The catheter was inserted into the chest until all catheter holes were well within the chest. The guidewire and trochar were then removed.  The tube was then attached to the collection drain apparatus and secured in place with suture and covered.   Fluid Removed: 450_ ml ‌  Serous  ‌ Serosanguinous X ‌ Bloody  ‌ Chylous ‌ Other:   Pleural pressures:  If not measured, please check here ‌X Opening:   cmH20   500 ml:      cmH20   1000ml:     cmH20       1500ml:     cmH20   2000ml      cmH20.          Drainage device:   ‌ Pleurovac    ‌ Drainage Bag  ‌ Heimlich Valve  X ‌ Pneumostat ‌ Other: Suction: ‌ X No ‌Yes, - ___ cmH20   CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS: X ‌ Image saved and uploaded to epic media tab Hemithorax:   X ‌ Right ‌ Left   Pleural Effusion: Volume:       ‌ None  ‌ X Minimal ‌ Small  ‌ Moderate  ‌ Large Echogenicity:   ‌ X Anechoic  ‌ Hypoechoic  ‌ Isoechoic ‌ Hyperechoic Loculations:  ‌ X None  ‌Thin  ‌ Thick Diaphragmatic Motion: X ‌ Normal  ‌ Diminished ‌ Absent  Lung: Lung sliding before procedure:   X ‌ Present ‌ Absent Lung sliding post procedure: X  ‌ Present ‌ Absent Lung consolidation/atelectasis: ‌ Present  X‌ Absent Pleura: ‌ Normal ‌ Thick  X ‌ Nodular   SPECIMEN(S): ‌X  LDH                        X ‌Glucose    X   ‌T. Protein   X  ‌Cholesterol ‌X Cell Count   ‌ ADA             ‌Triglycerides            ‌Amylase ‌X Gram Stain/ Culture          ‌AFB                         ‌ Fungal Culture ‌X Cytology      ‌Flow Cytometry                               ‌Other:   CXR ordered: ‌X  Yes ‌ No   COMPLICATIONS: X ‌None ‌Bleeding-EBL: ___ ml ‌Pneumothorax ‌Re-Expansion Pulmonary Edema ‌Other:   IMPRESSION/PLAN: Elen Rogers is a 65 year old-year-old female who presents for Chest Ultrasound and Chest tube placement. The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.   DISPOSITION: Nursing Unit [ ] f/u CXR [ ] f/u pleural fluid studies [ ] chest tube to water seal [ ] small bore flushing protocol   John Smith, MD 12/16/2025

per_code.summary: Selected for placement of indwelling pigtail catheter with ultrasound guidance. The note documents 'pigtail catheter was inserted using the Seldinger technique' and 'catheter... inserted into the chest'.

Dropped as bundled. While the note documents 'CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS', NCCI generally bundles diagnostic evaluation into the therapeutic procedure (32557) when performed at the same session, especially when 32557 includes 'imaging guidance'.

note_text:
Date of Service: 12/17/25 0930 Patient: Henderson, Mark (MRN 44521901) Attending Physician: Van Dyke, Dick, MD Service: Pulmonary / Critical Care 

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT 1 Happy Street Dr, Hollywood, CA92110
INDICATION FOR OPERATION: Mark Henderson is a 62 year-old male who presents with Complicated Parapneumonic Effusion. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Chest Ultrasound and Instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial) were discussed with the patient in detail. Patient indicated a wish to proceed with procedure and informed consent was signed. 

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Complicated Parapneumonic Effusion POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same as preoperative diagnosis - see above. 
PROCEDURE:

76604 Ultrasound, chest (includes mediastinum), real time with image documentation 

32561 Instillation(s), via chest tube/catheter, agent for fibrinolysis (eg, fibrinolytic agent for break up of multiloculated effusion); initial day 

ASSISTANT: Sarah Chen MD RN: bedside RN David Miller MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure. 
PROCEDURE IN DETAIL: PATIENT POSITION: ☐ Supine ☑ Sitting ☐ Lateral Decubitus: ☐ Right ☐ Left 
CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS: Hemithorax: ☑ Right ☐ Left Pleural Effusion: ☑ Volume: ☐ None ☐ Minimal ☐ Small ☑ Moderate ☐ Large ☑ Echogenicity: ☐ Anechoic ☐ Hypoechoic ☑ Isoechoic ☐ Hyperechoic ☑ Loculations: ☐ None ☐ Thin ☑ Thick ☑ Diaphragmatic Motion: ☑ Normal ☐ Diminished ☐ Absen
Lung: Lung sliding before procedure: ☑ Present ☐ Absent Lung consolidation/atelectasis: ☑ Present ☐ Absent Pleura: ☐ Normal ☑ Thick ☐ Nodular
Date of chest tube insertion: 12/16/2025 Side: Right ☑ 10 mg/5 mg tPA/Dnase 
COMPLICATIONS: ☑ None 
IMPRESSION/PLAN: Mark Henderson is a 62 year-old male who presents for Chest Ultrasound and Instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial).  The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications. DISPOSITION: Nursing Unit [] dwell for 1 hour [] chest tube to suction

findings.description: Right hemithorax pleural effusion: Large volume, Mixed echogenicity (Isoechoic/Hyperechoic), Thick loculations.
Pleura: Thick. Lung sliding: Present. No consolidation noted.

global_comments: Patient had chest tube placed on prior date (12/16). Current encounter is for fibrinolytic instillation.
Diagnostic ultrasound (76604) is separately reportable from instillation (32561) as it provides medical necessity (assessment of loculations) for the therapy.

note_text:

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT 1 Happy Street Dr, Hollywood, CA92110
INDICATION FOR OPERATION: Elen Rogers is a 55 year-old female who presents with Loculated Pleural Effusion. The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Chest Ultrasound and Instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial) were discussed with the patient in detail. Patient indicated a wish to proceed with procedure and informed consent was signed. 
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Loculated Pleural Effusion POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same as preoperative diagnosis - see above.

•	76604 Ultrasound, chest (includes mediastinum), real time with image documentation 
•	32561 Instillation(s), via chest tube/catheter, agent for fibrinolysis (eg, fibrinolytic agent for break up of multiloculated effusion); initial day 
ASSISTANT: Michael Chang MD RN: bedside RN Jessica Smith MONITORING: Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

CHEST ULTRASOUND FINDINGS: Hemithorax: ☐ Right ☑ Left Pleural Effusion: ☑ Volume: ☐ None ☐ Minimal ☐ Small ☐ Moderate ☑ Large ☑ Echogenicity: ☐ Anechoic ☑ Hypoechoic ☐ Isoechoic ☐ Hyperechoic ☑ Loculations: ☐ None ☑ Thin ☐ Thick ☑ Diaphragmatic Motion: ☐ Normal ☑ Diminished ☐ Absent 
Lung: Lung sliding before procedure: ☑ Present ☐ Absent Lung consolidation/atelectasis: ☑ Present ☐ Absent Pleura: ☑ Normal ☐ Thick ☐ Nodular 
Date of chest tube insertion: 12/17/2025 Side: Left ☑ 10 mg/5 mg tPA/Dnase 
COMPLICATIONS: ☑ None

global_comments: Procedure performed via existing chest tube (inserted 12/17/2025), so no chest tube insertion code (32551) is billed.
Diagnostic ultrasound 76604 is separately reportable as it provided detailed findings (volume, echogenicity, loculations) distinct from simple guidance.
Diagnosis J86.0 (Pyothorax with fistula/loculated) supports medical necessity.
